fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25088].
  {panel}

I see in the HTML that user names in gadgets like Filter Results have {{class="user-hover"}}. When I hover over each name though nothing pops up.

I bring this up because in Jira 4.1.2 we have a plugin that overrides the user-format so that links to all the users other than the current user go to a mailto: link rather than ViewProfile. Now that Jira 4.3 has the user hover pop up, which I love, this re-formatting of user-format is not necessary except in gadgets like Filter Results.

I would leave our user format code in and add a condition for when it's coming from Gadgets, but there's no easy way to tell inside the User Format code where the format request is coming from. 

And then there's Activity Streams (JRA-22089) ...
fields.summary: make user hovers work in gadgets

1. Create a project A
2. Manage Versions and add versions
3. Create Project B
4. Copy versions from A to B
5. Edit Project A versions.

This will now not be updated in B. Is there any way to do this?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25070].
  {panel}

The 'initial transition' (aka the 'Create Issue' transition') is a special type of transition that's available in all newly created JIRA workflows (as well as copies of the default workflow), which is activated when the user creates an issue and leads to the first step of an issue's workflow.

When you add a transition to any workflow in JIRA, JIRA automatically adds 5 'essential post functions' to that transition, which cannot be deleted.

On the other hand, a workflow's 'initial transition' only has 2 'essential post functions':
* One of which is 1 of the 5 'essential post functions' (required for other transitions)
* The other of which is unique to any workflow's 'initial transition'.

However, you can add the remaining 4 'essential post functions' (required for other transitions) to the 'initial transition', as 'optional post functions'. However, once they've been added, they cannot be removed.

Please ensure a 'Delete' link is available on these 'optional post functions' for the 'initial transition' as they are not 'essential post functions' in this context.

See this page for a workaround for JIRA server: [How to remove optional post functions from the initial transition in a workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+remove+optional+post+functions+from+the+initial+transition+in+a+workflow]

h3.Applicable Workaround for cloud:
- Create a new project as a new standard workflow
- Add the workflow to the workflow scheme for the project
- Change the workflow scheme for the project to use the new workflow
- Migrate existing issues to new project using bulk move
- delete the old workflow
fields.summary: You cannot delete / remove optional post functions which have been added to the 'initial transition' (i.e. 'Create' transition) of a JIRA workflow.
Formatting of noformat tag
Ability to sync jira data through REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25062].
  {panel}

Try to HTTP GET *anonymously* from /api/2.0.alpha1/component/{id}/relatedIssueCounts, where id is any an id of any component which is not accessible anonymously.

You would get NOT_FOUND whereas the error message suggests something different: "This user does not have permission to complete this operation."
It's obvious with this error message that such resource exists.
Two solutions:
- use UNAUTHORIZED when the resource is accessed anonymously and the person has no access to view it. (this is preferred IMO as in many places for anonymous attempts to access something we should ask person to authenticate first)
- change error message so that it does not indicate that the resource exists

When an authenticated attempt is made but the user is not authorized to see given component, then more correctly 404 is returned and the error message "The user XXX does not have permission to complete this operation." In such case sending UNAUTHORIZED does not make sense. So this part looks good.
fields.summary: HTTP error codes are used inconsistently by components resource

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25061].
  {panel}

"Recently Created Chart" gadget with weekly period displays issues created on 11-13 July in week 29, but the week 29 starts on 18 July.
h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new project and create some issues in it
# Add a Recently Created Chart in a dashboard. Configure it to point to the project and set its *Period* to *Weekly*

h4. Expected Results

The chart shows the issues being created in the correct week

h4. Actual Results

The newly created issues are shown in the wrong Week, specifically it shows it being created one week ahead

+Some screenshots:+
* Here are 6 issues created on 26th Jan 2016: [^JQL.png]
* Here's a date picker showing the correct week for 26th Jan 2016, which is the 4th week: [^DueDate.png]
* Here's the Recently Created gadget showing the 6 issues created, in *week 5* instead of week 4: [^RecentlyCreated.png]

h4. Notes

This also affects the Created vs. Resolved report/gadget
fields.summary: Recently Created Chart with weekly period shows issues shifted forwards by one week

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25060].

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 25th February 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

We have recognised that while we have provided some functionality to rename _screenshots_ while being attached to a JIRA ticket, this isn't a great user experience and missed the point for what many of you are asking for.

We agree that this is something that should be changed and because of this, I am reopening this suggestion. I must remind everyone this isn't a guarantee that this suggestion will be done immediately, however we would like to be open that implementing this would be the right thing to do.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

----


Hi,

After we have uploaded the attachment file to the issue, we would like to rename the attachment file name.
Can you please create a new feature in JIRA so that we can rename the attachment file?
fields.summary: Rename file attachment after file has been attached
Permissions for filter subscriptions not fine grained enough
Change in sub-task work calculations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25054].
  {panel}

{{moveIssuesTo}} in {{/api/2.0.alpha1/component/\{id\}?moveIssuesTo}} is in fact a URI (self) to a target component.

{{moveFixIssuesTo}} and {{moveAffectedIssuesTo}} in {{/api/2.0.alpha1/version/\{id\}?moveFixIssuesTo&moveAffectedIssuesTo}} are URIs too. 
Documentation does not suggest it. Naming convention either.
People will try ids, names, as usually passing full! URIs as arguments is not obvious.
fields.summary: Make clear that REST expects URIs as optional parameters while removing versions and components
Improve documentation for assigneeType in component resource
Documentation page needs to be deleted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25037].
  {panel}

I recently read Sarah M and Bruces posts about using a task and subtasks as a clone template for repeated tasks.  

http://ffeathers.wordpress.com/2011/04/12/jira-cloning-to-create-a-template-for-repeated-documentation-tasks/

And it got me thinking that we could offer variable replacement during clone to make it even more powerful.

In Sarahs examples she has Confluence X.X in each issue that she then needs to edit

What if we could replace them automatically

Something like ${version} becomes the value of a "version" variable at clone time.

I would change the clone dialog to allow a row of variable definitions.  We could track those variables per person so they dont have to re-enter them over time. 

This would make cloning even more powerful and powerful.
fields.summary: IDEA : Variable replacement during clone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25033].
  {panel}

Hi,

The customer is using JIRA in Hungarian with LDAP backend. The correct name ordering in Hungary is Surname first, and Givenname last. 
If they edit users in JIRA, and set "Full Name" in hungarian name order, then the givenName and sn LDAP attributes gets mixed up. The sn attribute will store the given name, and the givenName attribute will store the surname. As they use LDAP for other purposes too, they cannot do this. 

Please help.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Change Surname Givenname order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25031].
  {panel}

If you have a Post Function in your workflow that sets the remaining estimate to zero, and have a post function that will clear the remaining estimate to zero, it will change the original estimate to zero too.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Switch to Legacy Time Tracking Mode
2. Add a Post Function to your projects workflow that will set just the remaining estimate to 0m, not the original estimate.
3. Create a new issue with an Original Estimate of 5h
4. Close the issue and log 1 hour of work on the close screen, automatically adjust remaining estimate.
5. It will now have an original estimate of 0m and a remaining estimate of 0m, when the Original Estimate should remain at 5h.

This will not occur if you Create the issue, log work, then as a separate step, close the issue.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Legacy Mode and Workflow Post Functions Error

Mistaken escaping in the description
Allow Notification schemes to be assigned to projects all in one screen "Issues > Notification schemes"
make the vertical height of the Wiki Renderer noformat window configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25023].
  {panel}

Story: plugin developers want to create plugins with lots of features. Most plugins use Velocity templates for their UI features.

Problem: Velocity files in JIRA can use #parse and #macro to make them scale better. Plugins can't use #parse at all, and #macro only works within the same .vm file. 
This makes it hard for plugins to scale. Developing and debugging a large, monolithic .vm file is hard to get right.

Idea: modify the DefaultVelocityManager so that when it is used by a plugin it changes the Velocity engine properties and adds the resources directory as a valid TEMPLATE_ROOT for finding macros and .vm files to include. Document this with a small reference plugin that shows how to use these Velocity features to improve your own plugin.
fields.summary: Make Velocity files scale better for plugins
Link ids not returned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

The step to reproduce:
# change user preference to receive Text Formated email
# create a project with a long Project Key. Eg:LONGKEYABCXYZ
# create issues in the project
# create a filter that return the issues. Subscribe to the filter
# run the filter
# user will received the subscription and the issue key is concatenated with the following column. Please refer to the screenshot below:
!LongKey2.png!


This is reproducable in JIRA 4.1.2 and also JIRA 4.3.3.
fields.summary: Text Formatted Subscription Has Issue Key Concatenated To The Next Column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25008].
  {panel}

A similar new feature request has been resolved as won't fix, but the reasoning for the "won't fix" determination has a problem with it.

It is pointed out in the won't fix resolution that the Links Hierarchy plugin covers the functionality requested, but it does not for the following reason. The "blocks" links typically form a directed-acyclic-graph, not a tree. A DAG can have the following structure:

{noformat}
       C 
      / \
 A - B   E - F 
      \ /
       D
{noformat}

The Links Hierarchy Plug-in does not handle this case well. It shows multiples of E and F, one hanging off C and one off D.

PERT charts are a long-established and valuable project issue/task dependency management tool, and JIRA needs one.
I will be forced to hand-copy my issues into Visio bubbles and arrows until this feature happens in JIRA.
fields.summary: Directed-Acyclic-Graph view of blocks links to create PERT chart
Attachment Filenames With # Char Get Truncated
Remove version from REST API URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24991].
  {panel}

As part of my induction for JIRA support i've gone through the 4.4 installer guide and here's some feedback I've got. I've formatted so that the link to the page is followed by the issue I'm discussing.



http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+Java
- linux commands for setting JAVA_HOME missing (though this could be because of differences in distro) But I found that this is pretty standard...
echo JAVA_HOME="</PATH/TO/JAVA>" >> /etc/environment



http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Standalone+from+an+Archive+File+on+Windows%2C+Linux+or+Solaris

Can we make a note and link that using the .bin file is recommended over doing it manually from the archive file


1. Download and Extract the JIRA Standalone Archive File

This did not suggest where to put JIRA in the first place, though I understand if this is purposeful... we could say something like this if we thought it necessary.
mkdir -p /opt/atlassian/jira
mv *.tar.gz /opt/atlassian/jira
cd /opt/atlassian/jira
tar xfvz atlassian-jira-4.4-*.tar.gz
ln -s atlassian-jira-4.4-BLAH current


2. Set the JIRA Home Directory in JIRA

Can we have the path of application.properties without having to click for it?
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties

Only a small thing but I think it's more of a convention to use </suggested/paths> as such.
export JIRA_HOME = </path/to/jira/home>
Can we give an example that it's usually set as something like /var/atlassian/jira ?

I think exporting can be risky because the system will forget it when logged out and in again. Instead maybe something like:
echo JIRA_HOME=/var/atlassian/jira >> /etc/environment



3. Create a Dedicated User Account on the Operating System to Run JIRA

Can we suggest a dedicated user account AND group?

groupadd atlassian
Then add the user jira and put it into the group atlassian:
useradd --create-home --comment "Account for running JIRA" --shell /bin/bash jira -G atlassian

Suggestion for setting permissions
chown -R jira:atlassian </path/to/jira/install>
chmod 770 </path/to/jira/install> (please tighten for security if necessary)
chown -R jira:atlassian </path/to/jira/home>
chmod 770 </path/to/jira/home> (please tighten for security if necessary)


4. Start JIRA

Wait until the following message appears in the application's log file: - give path to log file instead of having to click elsewhere.

If JIRA does not appear in your web browser, you may need to change the port that JIRA runs on.
Also suggest to check OS and network firewalls


http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+the+Setup+Wizard

Can we please link to a page on dragons (or wherever) that tells the customer how to set up on different databases eg: postgres...

Basic Postgres setup information:
yum install postgresql84-libs.x86_64 postgresql84-server.x86_64 postgresql84-devel.x86_64
su postgres
initdb /var/lib/pgsql/data
* check postgresql.conf 
(adjust security)
listen_addresses = '*'  
* check pg_hba.conf
(adjust security)
host    all         all       0.0.0.0/0               trust
exit
/etc/init.d/postgresql start
su postgres
createuser jira_user
Shall the new role be a superuser? (y/n) n
Shall the new role be allowed to create databases? (y/n) y
Shall the new role be allowed to create more new roles? (y/n) n
CREATE ROLE
$ /usr/local/pgsql/bin/createdb jira_db -O jira_user
CREATE DATABASE
test database and enable password:
psql postgres postgres
\l (lists all databases)
ALTER USER postgres WITH PASSWORD 'tmppassword';



http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL#ConnectingJIRAtoPostgreSQL-databaseconfig

Open a console and execute config.sh in the bin subdirectory of the JIRA Installation Directory.
Can we make a note that the costumer will need a GUI on Linux for this.



http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Standalone+on+Linux

I thought that the name was a little generic "Installing JIRA Standalone on Linux" 
Maybe can we change it to something like "Installing JIRA Standalone on Linux using self extracting setup wizard"?
Reiterate that this will be the recommended way to perform an install

 If JIRA does not appear, you may need to change the port that JIRA runs on.
 pelase add "Also check OS and network firewalls blocking your chosen port"
fields.summary: Jira 4.4 installer doc feedback

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24989].
  {panel}

I need a dashboard gadget and I can't figure out how to create it. The style should be similar to 'Greenhopper Days Remaining' - Big Bold Number. 

The information it should provide relates to Service Level Agreement commitment projections based on historical data. This concept is especially used with Kanban processes, where a commitment is made as a new task starts, that it will be complete within <statistic> days. 

The commitment is based on the (recent) historical mean for the cycle time (ie."work started" - to - "done" period) for issues [of that type] PLUS 2 standard deviations. 

The problem I am striking is that JQL seems too primitive to allow me to select an appropriate set of records and perform statistical calculations based on values for certain fields in those records.

What is needed is:
Where Project is <name>
  Pick the (configurable number) most recently "Closed" or "Resolved" issues
    For these issues, calculate the mean and standard deviation from the time difference between the "work started" and "done" timestamps
      Display = Mean + (2 * Sigma)

Of course this would also be best with additional filtering, so the set of issues calculated over would be taken from a selected Component or Version or Assignee. As we are using 'shirt size' estimates via a custom field, it would be good to filter based on that also, so that we can have a gadget that displays the current SLA commitment for each estimation size.

An additional option to display the actual mean would be useful also.

I attach suggested graphic and config mockups
fields.summary: New Gadget for SLA Commitment Period based on recent historical Cycle Time
Allow voting per project
change user separator to something else than ","
The gadget directory code will wait forever on the gadget provider and this can hang the ability to add gadgets
Remove the Sybil code in AbstractIssueSelectAction that causes multiple reads to the database when we have already done it
Better rendering of custom fields in statistics gadgets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24976].
  {panel}

We have a long list of issues caused by the warning we give went a form is partially filled and you navigate away from the page without finishing.

There are three ways to fix this that I can see:
# Remove the dirty warnings javascript all together and rely on the browser to warn the user.
# Make the dirty form code selective in that you have a list of the forms it applies to.
# Make the dirty form code less picky eg. 3 form elements have changed or a text field has an additional 140 characters.

I kinda like the third option but initially want to investigate the best way to go forward.
fields.summary: Improve Dirty Forms handling.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24968].
  {panel}

In some situation non critical bundled plguin may not be initiated correctly. That will cause the application to lock up and fail to start up.

For e.g. if on upgrade the plugin got disabled due to some errors, on any subsequent startups JIRA reports:
{noformat}
********************************************************************************
JIRA 4.3.4 build: 620 started. You can now access JIRA through your web browser.
********************************************************************************

2011-06-26 15:26:23,639 main FATAL      [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] 

***********************************************************************************************************************
The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started: FishEye Plugin (com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin)
***********************************************************************************************************************

2011-06-26 15:26:23,661 main FATAL      [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher] Skipping, JIRA is locked.
2011-06-26 15:26:23,661 main INFO      [atlassian.jira.scheduler.JiraSchedulerLauncher] JIRA Scheduler not started: JIRA startup checklist failed.
2011-06-26 15:26:24,118 main FATAL      [jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher] 

******************************************
JIRA startup failed, JIRA has been locked.
******************************************
{noformat}

The locking mechanism was introduced due to [JRA-22633|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22633].

The only way to fix this problem is to change the status of the plugin with help of db manipulation.
fields.summary: Exclude non critical plugins from being included the failed initiation check
Document the effects of jira.dev.mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24961].
  {panel}

Story: a JIRA administrator (or JIRA user) wants to perform some set of actions many hundreds of times. These actions are available via the web to the user. 
Many administrators open a new tab for each action in turn, because there is no easy way to automate bulk operations, e.g. changing a scheme on a project.

Aim: make JIRA configuration and maintenance scale as well as JIRA data does by making it easier for users to automate actions in JIRA

Currently administrators have a few choices. Users have fewer choices. All these choices are:

1. UI tools (Selenium) - pretty crude and sensitive to UI changes
2. A SOAP/REST plugin to expose an API to execute the set of operations, and then use a client-side script. This is probably the most common approach right now.
3. A plugin to execute just that set of operations - can be a fair amount of work, not clear which internal APIs to use or how to use them
4. A Jelly script - outdated, little support in the last three years
5. (JIRA 4.3 and later) Speakeasy is the client-side approach to doing this in the browser, but it doesn't allow access to all the actions that administrators or users may want to use.

There are at least two plugins available that let you execute Groovy, JRuby, Jython etc scripts inside JIRA. They are Script Runner (https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/6820) and JIRA REST CLI (http://leonardinius.blogspot.com/2011/03/release-announcement-jira-rest-cli-05.html and https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/40268)


This issue is the result of a number of discussions at Summit, plus feedback received on "Practical JIRA Administration" (O'Reilly, 2011).
fields.summary: The Hundred Tab Problem
Bulk Edit Group Members: Please display user full name in Group Members box
Receive only one email notification even if I am member of several notified categories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24954].
  {panel}

Hi, this is probably a bit unusual, but I'm filing a ticket to provide you guys with a solution. Your article on this was a huge help in correlating the fact that these crashes weren't unique to our product, so thought you'd be interested in the Java bug we've raised with Oracle, as these have caused significant problems for our clients:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/JIRA+with+GreenHopper+Crashes+Java+with+a+SIGSEGV+Fault+on+Linux+64bit+JVMs

The short summary is: stack overflows in Java native calls should never crash the JVM, unless you have your own native library that's deeply recursing. Crashes have been confirmed to be prevented with a -XX:StackShadowPages=20 on Linux x86_64 and may also address these on UltraSPAC (sparcv9).

Cheers!
Danny

Java bug: http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=7059899

{quote}
As our clients have migrated to 64-bit JVMs we've seen a significant number of JVM crashes due to SIGSEGV on Unix platforms. These are spontaneous and do not trigger a HotSpot crash report. Each crash involved an application bug that caused deep recursion that should have resulted in a java.lang.StackOverflowError, for instance an infinite struts forward or a search continuance/referral loop during LDAP authentication. This affects both Solaris and Linux platforms, but a 64-bit JVM is always the common factor.

We referred to the Java SE Troubleshooting Guide section '4.1.3 Crash due to Stack Overflow' and found that likely, the StackShadowPages value is too small for these platforms. The guide discusses custom JNI libraries, however we're seeing these conditions in "normal" native calls, usually socket operations, reads or writes, which lead us to investigate further, as this should not be the case. According to the OpenJDK source the default on x84 platforms is 3, and is doubled to 6 on AMD64. There is a x86 Solaris value, seemingly to accomodate C++ compiler bugs on that platform, however our experience has shown that perhaps this is 

http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk6/jdk6/hotspot/file/9b013e207574/src/cpu/x86/vm/globals_x86.hpp
{code}
       60 #ifdef AMD64
       61 // Very large C++ stack frames using solaris-amd64 optimized builds
       62 // due to lack of optimization caused by C++ compiler bugs
       63 define_pd_global(intx, StackShadowPages, SOLARIS_ONLY(20) NOT_SOLARIS(6) DEBUG_ONLY(+2));
       64 #else
       65 define_pd_global(intx, StackShadowPages, 3 DEBUG_ONLY(+5));
       66 #endif // AMD64
{code}

We can only conclude that either 64-bit stack frames on AMD64 are generally far larger than their 32-bit equivalents or there's a problem with the way this value is calculated (I believe it's OS pagesize * StackShadowPages), allowing previously benign stack overflows in Java code to crash the JVM. Lab testing indicates that 17 was is the smallest StackShadowPages size that prevented the JVM from crashing with a segmentation fault. We have not confirmed the value on Solaris (UltraSPARC, we don't support our product on Solaris x86), however we have certainly seen these conditions affect both platforms. 

Others have also encountered 64-bit specific SIGSEGVs, bug 6346701 seems to report exactly this kind of condition, however I could not see an outright discussion anywhere that indicated that there could be a problem with the default shipping value or calculation of the number of pages to look ahead before invoking native methods:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/JIRA+with+GreenHopper+Crashes+Java+with+a+SIGSEGV+Fault+on+Linux+64bit+JVMs
http://fusesource.com/forums/thread.jspa?messageID=7830

We identified the offending threads using gdb, and jstack thread dumps identified the following two crash use cases:
 
Crash 1 - Two application methods that call each other recursively, executing database statements, causing overflow during Oracle thin driver socket read:
{noformat}
Thread 18073: (state = IN_NATIVE)
- java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(java.io.FileDescriptor, byte[], int, int, int) @bci=0 (Compiled frame; information may be imprecise)
- java.net.SocketInputStream.read(byte[], int, int) @bci=84, line=129 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.net.ns.Packet.receive() @bci=31, line=240 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.net.ns.DataPacket.receive() @bci=1, line=92 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.net.ns.NetInputStream.getNextPacket() @bci=48, line=172 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.net.ns.NetInputStream.read(byte[], int, int) @bci=33, line=117 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.net.ns.NetInputStream.read(byte[]) @bci=5, line=92 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CMAREngine.buffer2Value(byte) @bci=325, line=2320 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CMAREngine.unmarshalUB4() @bci=2, line=1200 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.unmarshal() @bci=200, line=270 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.receive() @bci=1507, line=1015 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.doOall8(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean) @bci=655, line=194 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.executeForDescribe() @bci=39, line=791 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.executeMaybeDescribe() @bci=104, line=866 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.doExecuteWithTimeout() @bci=139, line=1186 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeInternal() @bci=98, line=3387 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeQuery() @bci=13, line=3431 (Compiled frame)
- oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.executeQuery() @bci=4, line=1491 (Compiled frame)
- org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery() @bci=9, line=93 (Compiled frame)
- org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery() @bci=9, line=93 (Compiled frame)
...
{noformat}

Crash 2 - Infinite LDAP search referral/continuance due to incorrectly configured Active Directory server, overflowing during socket write:

{noformat}
Thread 11962: (state = IN_NATIVE)
 - java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0(java.io.FileDescriptor, byte[], int, int) @bci=0 (Interpreted frame)
 - java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(byte[], int, int) @bci=44, line=92 (Interpreted frame)
 - java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(byte[], int, int) @bci=4, line=136 (Interpreted frame)
 - java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flushBuffer() @bci=20, line=65 (Interpreted frame)

 - com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.writeRequest(com.sun.jndi.ldap.BerEncoder, int, boolean) @bci=73, line=396 (Interpreted frame)
 - com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapClient.ldapBind(java.lang.String, byte[], javax.naming.ldap.Control[], java.lang.String, boolean) @bci=196, line=334 (Interpreted frame)
 - com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapClient.authenticate(boolean, java.lang.String, java.lang.Object, int, java.lang.String, javax.naming.ldap.Control[], java.util.Hashtable) @bci=315, line=192 (Interpreted frame)

 - com.sun.jndi.url.ldap.ldapURLContextFactory.getObjectInstance(java.lang.Object, javax.naming.Name, javax.naming.Context, java.util.Hashtable) @bci=17, line=35 (Interpreted frame)
 - javax.naming.spi.NamingManager.getURLObject(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object, javax.naming.Name, javax.naming.Context, java.util.Hashtable) @bci=62, line=584 (Interpreted frame)

fields.summary: Investigate on usage of StackShadowPages attribute in order to prevent SIGSEGV JVM crashes
Make OfBize SequenceUtil less wasteful
Make cog menus location aware

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24948].
  {panel}

If you already have a filter loaded and you go to Manage Filters and click the +Subscribe+ or +1 Subscription+ link from another filter, the title of the page will still be for the filter you had previously loaded. This is very confusing because you have to trust that Jira actually will subscribe you to the filter whose link you clicked rather than the title you see.

+To Reproduce+
# load a filter like say, 'Good Bugs'
# Go to Manage Filters
# Click the +Subscribe+ link for a filter other than Good Bugs, like say the 'Interesting Improvements' filter

+Expected Result+
The title of that screen would say something like 'create a filter subscription for Interesting Improvements'

+Actual Result+
# At the top of the screen in the biggest print it says *Issue Navigator - Good Bugs* which really throws me because I swore I clicked +subscribe+ on the Interesting Improvements filter, not the Good Bugs filter.
!2 confusing title.png|thumbnail!
# If you click the Subscribe button, it turns out that all is actually ok and it's just the title is still revealing the active filter in the session rather than the filter that I clicked +subscribe+ for. 
# But now I see 2 different filter titles in the same screen which is also confusing.
!3 oh, but it's ok.png|thumbnail!

+More Information+
This doesn't occur in 4.1.2 because there is no additional "Issue Navigator - Filter Name" title in 4.1
fields.summary: Confusing title on screen following Click of 'subscribe' link from Manage Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24943].
  {panel}

I able replicate this problem in JIRA 4.1.2 standalone. Steps to replicate the problem:

Create a custom field (e.g. Free Text Field (unlimited text) custom field type) that only associate to the sub-task issue type and also the screen (e.g. Sub-Task screen) that used by the sub-task.
Create a Testing Project (e.g. TST).
Create an issue and also with a sub-task under that issue.
Ensure there is a value being entered into that particular custom field.
Go to the Issue Navigator and use the following JQL query to list out all the sub-tasks under a specific parent task. For example:
project = Testing AND issuetype = Sub-task AND parent = "TST-1"
Go to Views > Excel (All Fields) to generate the Excel file.
The Excel file does not includes with the custom field.

*Other testing:- Add a column in Issue Navigator*

Go to Tools > Add Columns and add the custom field to be viewable in Issue Navigator.
Return to the Issue Navigator for the search result but the column is not added.
Try to generate the Excel report but the custom field still not exists in the Excel file.

*Successful testing*

If you use the following JQL query that lists out all the sub-tasks:
project = Testing AND issuetype = Sub-task
Generate the Excel report and the custom field will appear in the report.
fields.summary: Advanced Query view list results excel export doesn't include custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24937].
  {panel}

This issue supercedes CWD-2515. I have had a chat with Olli Nevalainen and we agreed that this is a good improvement request for the behavior of JIRA when a user is deleted from the AD side or from Crowd.

Currently, the user would disappear from the JIRA user browser and will show up in gray color in the issues when he is the assignee of reporter. However, this may cause problems later on. I have witnessed one problem of it when retrieving SOAP remote issues which their assignee/reporter does not exist in JIRA due to him/her being deleted from LDAP/Crowd side. There may be more hidden problems about it.

Deleting a user who matches any of this criteria was never possible from the UI:
# Assignee of any issue
# Reporter of any issue
# Lead of any project

Thus, I have raised this improvement request to keep the user in JIRA even after being deleted from the external user management system, but as an inactive user (he/she will not be able to log-in anyway).

Regards,
Ali
fields.summary: When a user is deleted in AD or Crowd, JIRA could keep the user in JIRA as an inactive user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24934].
  {panel}

Hello,

I am a member of the *FE&A Jira Administrators* team and want to know how to provide only the "Browse Project" and "Delete Issues" permissions to a group I have created in Jira.

The scenario in short is that when I provide the mentioned permissions globally to this group, it should get added to all the existing permission schemes. I cannot find a way to add it though the "Global Permissions" or "Project Role Browser".

If there is there any other way to accomplish this task, it would be very helpful to let me know.

I am available from 08:00 to 18:00 EST on Office Communicator and JPMIM. Please ping me if you need any additional information.

Regards,
Rahul Savaikar
fields.summary: How to provide global permissions to a group in Jira
screen for project workflow scheme migration buries the space admin in old -> new status mappings that are completely irrelevant
Duration calculation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24926].
  {panel}

h4. Update

See [comment below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24926?focusedCommentId=259508&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-259508] for an update on what needs to be done to address this issue.

h4. Problem description:
I have noticed that when the documentation instructions are followed from here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Installing+JIRA+on+Tomcat+6.0

Due to step 4 instructions:
{quote}
Tomcat does not come with some libraries required to run JIRA. To fix this, download

http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/jira-jars-tomcat-distribution-4.3-tomcat-6x.zip
and copy the contained jars to Tomcat's lib/ directory. (Be sure to remove existing versions of these JAR before copying the new ones.)

    In particular, to prevent exceptions related to logging, please ensure that commons-logging-1.0.4.jar and log4j-1.2.15.jar are present in Tomcat's /lib/ directory. Also ensure that these files are not present in Tomcat's webapps/jira/WEB-INF/lib directory.

Additionally, if you are running Sun's distribution of Tomcat, download tomcat-dbcp.jar and copy it to the tomcat6/lib directory.
{quote}

The jar files below will end up in both of the directories:
* _<TOMCAT>\webapp\jira\WEB-INF\lib_
* _<TOMCAT>\lib_

| jcl-over-slf4j-1.5.8.jar |
| jul-to-slf4j-1.5.8.jar |
| slf4j-api-1.5.8.jar |
| slf4j-log4j12-1.5.8.jar |

h4. Impact analysis:
Due to this, JIRA may possibly encounter errors like:

{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: XSRF white list failure
{code}

Even if not, it does not make sense that there should be duplicate jar files accessible to JIRA.

h4. Suggested resolution:
* Either these jar files can be removed from the JIRA jars tomcat distribution libraries:
http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/jira-jars-tomcat-distribution-4.3-tomcat-6x.zip
* Or the documentation needs to be updated to warn about these duplicates and ask the user to delete them if they exist.

_Note: tested with JIRA 4.3. The same problem may exist with massive amount of JIRA versions_

Thank you very much,
Ali
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Remove duplicate JAR libraries from the "jira-jars-tomcat-distribution-X.Y-tomcat-6x.zip" (and "jira-jars-tomcat-distribution-X.Y-tomcat-5x.zip") files which are already included in the JIRA WAR distribution (or vice versa).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24923].
  {panel}

There are a number of times when a simple totals row on find results would be incredibly useful.

Particularly, I would like to run a query for "all tasks assigned to Joe by version 0.8 that are Open" and see a total line at the bottom that tells me how much time is left in the estimated work column.

Also suitable for Story Points, Business Value, various estimations etc. 

Now, we do it through Greasemonkey scripting.
fields.summary: As a JIRA user I need to view Totals row on results pages in IssueNavigator on specified columns (number types)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

For Roadmaps and/or Changelog

In each project, there can be sub projects that follow different version names. 

Is it possible to filter the list of version by attributes like module/components or even group by ? 

This is because essentially both panel display almost the same data with no sort/grouping ability. 


Thanks

As a Plugin developer, I would like to create an internal custom field type that does not show up in the JIRA admin page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24914].
  {panel}

Hi,

When searching for tickets which contain german umlauts it is not possible to find these when searching with typical recoded umlauts.

Example: A ticket holds the word Rückläufer. I would like to search for it by the phrase 'ruecklaeufer'. The queried ticket is not returned.

The vice versa issue also would be nice to have addressed: ticket holds the word Ruecklaeufer, I want to find it with the query rückläufer.

Please see below to understand the request :
||Issue text||Search term||Match|| 
|Rückläufer|Rückläufer|Yes| 
|Rückläufer|Rucklaufer|Yes|
|Rückläufer|ruecklaeufer|No| (feature being requested)
|ruecklaeufer|Rückläufer|No| (feature being requested)

Thanks,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Search for phrases with 'ue', 'ae', 'oe' does not return respective german umlauts in result set
JNDI database installation option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24907].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 2 May 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

I am excited to give an update re: this issue. *We have made the autocomplete search functionality to be case insensitive* when searching within the label field, or a custom field that uses the custom field type of labels. 

This means when searching for a label within the issue detail view, or basic JQL, the results returned will be case insensitive. Users can still create a separate label that is a different case. E.g. 'Taylor' and 'taylor' will be stored as two different labels if you want to do so.

We believe that making the autocomplete search functionality case insensitive, it will prevent users from creating derivative labels of the same name because users will see all available options regardless of case. At the same time, users are still able to create specific labels by case if they need to. E.g. 'Taylor' and 'taylor' will be stored as two different labels, which is existing functionality. 

This should make it much more usable moving forward without negatively affecting what is currently stored as labels in your projects today.

If you have any questions or would like to see anything else re: this issue, please add your comments below.

 

Enjoy!

Taylor Pechacek
 tpechacek@atlassian.com
 Senior Product Manager, Jira
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When applying a label, JIRA will not find existing labels that have a different case:

!Label_search_not_case-insensitive.jpg|thumbnail!

Basic search has the same behavior:

!Screen Shot 2015-05-13 at 10.05.41.jpg|thumbnail!
 !Screen Shot 2015-05-13 at 10.05.33.jpg|thumbnail!

An *advanced* search, using JQL, will find all labels and is case insensitive.
{code:java}
labels="it_maintenance"{code}
returns all results.
h3. Suggested Solution

Labels should be case insensitive. That is, if an issue already has a label *Australia* then it shouldn't allow a second label *AUSTRALIA*

There isn't any use to be able to label an issue as *Australia*, *australia* and *AUSTRALIA* because searching for the word Australia in any case will return the issue.
fields.summary: labels should be case insensitive
Long release names cause overlap in the chart gadget
Add a "Select All" button to the Retain column while changing issue types
Provide a path to migrate user information from Crowd to JIRA during the upgrade to version with Crowd Embeded
Encapsulate, Reusable Post-Functions
Users not active still show up in user picker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24883].
  {panel}

Hi there,

There is a little mistake here I believe:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008#ConnectingJIRAtoSQLServer2008-5.1ConfigureyourapplicationservertoconnecttoSQLServer

Look for the yellow box message:
{quote}
	If you have a named instance, your string may look like url="jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://localhost:1433/jiradb;instance=instance_name"
{quote}

As far as I can see in [SQL server 2008 documentation|http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms378428.aspx], [there is no property|http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms378988.aspx] which is named "instance". Please correct me if I am wrong. Kindly fix the documentation as necessary.

Cheers,
Ali
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Documentation error in Connecting JIRA to SQL server 2008

fields.description:
If a filter becomes invalid because of a renamed / removed filter or component it would be good to have it picked up by the integrity checker.

Currently if there is an OR statement in the subscription filters (for example: invalid JQL OR valid JQL) it will pass the checkers validation, and not be picked up as an issue.
fields.summary: Improve Filter Integrity Checking
System administrators should be able to add packages to be logged at run time and without making changes on the file system or requiring a restart.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24865].
  {panel}

+Use Case+
# fairly new but brave and wily user named Ima Newby logs into Jira and sees as her default dashboard the system default dashboard. Ima decides she needs something more suited to her needs for her default Jira dashboard and realizes that there is a way to do it
# Ima goes to Tools -> Create Dashboard and chooses to start by creating a blank dashboard

+Expected Result+
Her old Dashboard (the System Dashboard) would still be an option to easily revert back to or look at with 1 click

+Actual Result+
# To find that old Dashboard, Ima Newby has to go to Dashboards -> Manage Dashboards
# click Search
# click the Search button again
# Know that the old Dashboard was called *System Dashboard* (which is highly unlikely that any user other than 1 or 2 administrators know this)
# Scroll through the pages of available dashboards until she finds *System Dashboard* which on our system is on the 19th page of Dashboards

+Solution+
By default all users have the *System Dashboard* as a favorite. Until they make a second dashboard, this solution affects nothing. Once they make a second dashboard, it's much easier for them to un-favorite the System Dashboard than to search for it and re-favorite it.
fields.summary: System Dashboard should by default remain as a favourite after a new user creates a new dashboard
Delete a user from a particular directory only
Move jira.table.cols.subtasks out of jira-application.properties and into DB
Allow searching for a priority number value range
Federated Issue Linking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24846].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

Looking for documentation about OSWorkflow, I discovered that the Documentation is no more online.
See http://www.opensymphony.com/
Sources are here ; http://java.net/projects/osworkflow
Do you know where these documentation are deployed ?
If not, can Atlassian provide service ?

V.
fields.summary: OpenSymphony documentation ?!
alert user when timed-out and/or disallow entry once timed out - updates lost!
Create sub-task for an issue in another project
Allow New Project Roles to be implemented globally
Option to Sort Project Admin Page by Project Key/Project Lead
configurable project panels
JQL javascript parser approves syntax that server fails.
Include new icons with default icons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24806].
  {panel}

Need ability to both "Share" Comments or an Issue with users who are not assignees, reporters or watchers.  

First, the comment feature should allow us to "cc" a comment within an issue. Would be nice to have an optional field that allows us to enter an email address. This way, both the reporter and "cc'ed" user gets the comment. 

Currently, we have to email a comment, and then copy paste it back into JIRA issue, which then sends out a notification again to the reporter. Not elegant. 

Second, having a "Share" button in JIRA, like the latest/upcoming Confluence version does would be icing on the cake, so we can share full issues with another user.
fields.summary: Share Comment & Issue feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24804].
  {panel}

As of JIRA there is a regression where Issue Links column in Excel export isn't hyperlinked any longer.

Excel export in *JIRA 3.12*

!export312.png!


Excel export in *JIRA 4.3*

!export43.png!

Copies of the export files attached
fields.summary: Issue Links column in Excel export isn't hyperlinked
Need to clear "Could not find file at this location" when after an existing file is selected
Login screen with captcha should clear password field
Possibility to mention a Jira user in a comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24787].
  {panel}

With two different domains one user effectively has two different email addresses - user@domain1 and user@domain2. 
Email handlers should be able recognise that it is the same user and add comment / create issue as appropriate user.

Currently if email to JIRA is sent from user@domain2 JIRA ignores the email.

Studio has already provided this partially by overriding one of JIRA's class. Pleaes see [JST-3171|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-3171]. Currently this can only be modified by a sysadmin.

This fix does not support assigning issue from email if the assignee's email address is using an alias. Please see [JST-5079|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5079] to track its progress.

When JIRA implements this improvement, it would be appreciated to keep this backward compatible with Studio.
fields.summary: Support multiple email domains when creating issues/comments from email
When JIRA is caching users from LDAP, it should also store the base dn for the user and the refered server where the user can be authenticated.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24779].
  {panel}

After 9 years of development in our Jira 'TRI' Project, we have more than 1200 versions in total, from which 940 archived. With this long list, it becomes very time consuming to Release, Archive, Unarchive or Delete versions, as it has to be done one by one, while it gets slower and slower because of the number of versions.

The essence of the problem with the Jira Version management functionality is the bad performance with about 1200 versions (or more) in the database. I make the assumption this has to do with the fact that all (>1200) versions are retreived, every time one action (release, archive, unarchive, edit, delete) is done. Moreover, on the project overview screen, just the top 15 version are shown as read-only, and a seperate link to view them all.

The solution I propose is simple; just adding an option (Boolaan, checkbox) on the Jira Version Management screen, someting like 'Show archived versions' (default on No).When this option is No (false), the Archived versions are not retreived after every action, and not (default) shown on the Version Management page. I expect this will largely increase the performance of this functionality.

Kind regards,
Hans Brouwer
Triodos Bank NV 
Netherlands
fields.summary: Performance improvement: Don't show Archived versions by default on the Jira Version management screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24776].
  {panel}

Hello all,
I would like to implement a JIRA project for test management purposes, using 2 different issue types, "Test Plan" and "Test Case".

One "Test Plan" can have more than one "Test Case"
One "Test Case" can relate to more than one "Test Plan" (or if you want "Test Case"'s can be shared among "Test Plan"'s
Each "Test Plan" should aggregate time estimates for all the "Test Case"'s associated to it
Things I have already tried:

Create "Test Plan" and "Test Case" issue types; Link "Test Case"'s to the relevant "Test Plan"'s. OUTCOME: Works fine for sharing "Case"'s among "Plan"'s but does not aggregate time estimates
Create "Test Plan" as issue types and "Test Case"'s as sub-task of a plan. OUTCOME: Works fine for calculating overall "Test Plan"'s estimates but does not allow sharing of "Test Case"'s sub tasks among "Test Plans"
Use Structure to organize the hierarchical model. OUTCOME: Works well for calculating overall estimates by aggregating estimates of each child "Test Case" but does not allow sharing of "Test Case"'s among Test Plan (once a "Test Case" is inserted in the structure under a plan, it is not available any more to be added under a second plan)

When I submitted my issue to JIRA support (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-81631) I was told that this is unattainable at present but that I should request a new feature to make it possible to share a sub-task (in the example above a Test Case) among more than one parent task (in the example above a Test Plan) and still get the parent issue Test Plan estimates to aggregate the estimates of all the sub-tasks associated to it.

Thanks a million in advance,

Marco
fields.summary: Allowing sharing a sub-task among parent tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24775].
  {panel}

We currently use Jira 4.2 and we want to be able to run a query that shows issues that have changed source code files or those that don't. There is a "source" tab that shows the change-sets for a specific jira issue but there is no query-able field on the UI for the same. 

I would have used either of the below plugins below but both don't resolve this issue.
->Jira Fisheye plugin(https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/FISH-326) 
->Jira Subversion plugin(https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/SVN-319)
fields.summary: Functionality to filter Jira tickets by change-sets.
Use meta property indicating the active section/tab in admin pages to detect correct tab context in Studio
